Class Gameplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • Gameplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class Gameplay
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener
    The Gameplay class. Manages the game, switching between typing, display of text to type, and letting the user choose what they want to type. used for the visual novel.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • instructions

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> instructions
        The ArrayList of instructions to be carried out by the Gameplay class.

      • index

        int index
        The current index in the game. Each portion of the game has its own line.

      • lines

        int lines
        The total number of lines in the current game script.

      • mode

        int mode
        What the Gameplay class is currently handling. 0 is visualnovel-style text which the user advances through, 1 is prompting the user to select text, and 2 is prompting the user to type text.

      • completed

        boolean completed
        Whether or not this part of the game is fully completed.

      • enemyText

        java.lang.String enemyText
        The text the enemy will type.

        The text the player will type.

        The question to ask the user.

      • responses

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> responses
        The list of possible Strings the user will type.

      • correctResponse

        int correctResponse
        The correct response to type, as an index in the responses variable. All incorrect responses typed will make the enemy type faster.

      • ts

        TextSelector ts
        The TextSelector for use when the player chooses what text they want to type.

      • enemyTextObj

        Text enemyTextObj
        The Text objects the enemy and player will type respectively.

        The class constructor. Creates the visual novel.

    • Method Detail

      • generateScript

        public void generateScript(int script,
                           int tree)
        Searches through the list of scripts for a script with this particular gameplay, then loads each line from this script into the instructions. The formatting for scripts can be found inside any gameplay script file located in /scripts.
        Parameters:
        script - The particular script to search for.

      • addBg

        public void addBg()
        Removes the background from the JPanel, then adds it again to manage layers.
        Parameters:
        The - background int to add.

      • addTextBox

        public void addTextBox()
        Removes the textbox from the JPanel, then adds it again to manage layers.

      • addHealthBar

        public void addHealthBar()
        Removes the health bar from the JPanel, then adds it again to manage layers.

      • next

        public void next()
        Follows the next instruction. If the instruction is a visual novel instruction (starts with 0) then sets the mode to 0 and displays text, waiting for the space or enter key to be pressed. If the instruction is a selector (starts with 1), then it will set the mode to 1, take the enemy's text to type, possible responses, question, and best possible response, and create a text selector, waiting for the user to make a selection. If the user selects the wrong answer, then the enemy's speed will be increased. Whether or not the right answer is selected, the user will have to type out the sentence. The game will create the sentence to type.

      • typeText

        public void typeText()
        Creates the sentence to type. Called after the user selects something using TextSelector.

      • getPanel

        public void getPanel()
        Reorders the current JPanel to account for layers.

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Returns the current line in the script.

        Returns the total number of lines in the script.
